alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 05 at 9:47PM AKDT until October 06 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy freezing rain, and snow. Ice accumulations of up to one- quarter inch. Snow Accumulation one 1 inch. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Ice will accumulate on trees and power lines and could cause power outages. Driving and walking surfaces will become very slippery. Travel could be very difficult. Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Over one tenth of an inch of ice has accumulated one near the Robertson River as of 930 PM Thu. Lighter amounts occurred at Northway. Freezing rain will continue tonight and taper off early Fri morning. Up to one quarter inch of ice is possible by early Friday which may cause tree branches to fall onto power lines. Roads will be ice coated and very slippery. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. &&
